messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] GREAT BOOK
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/31/00 6:23:29 AM Pacific Daylight Time, snmanns@attcanada.ca writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/31/00 6:23:29 AM Pacific Daylight Time,
snmanns@... writes:

<< I am currently reading "The Teenage Liberation Handbook - How to quit
school
and get a real life and education" by Grace Llewellyn. It's fabulous!!

Anyone here read that one?
>>

That is one I've been meaning to read. I hear great things about it, but I've
been on a book budget lately and have to be quite careful how I spend. I tend
to get carried away at the bookstore. I'm currently reading Summerhill A
Radical Approach to Child Rearing by A.S. Neill. A bit freudian for my
tastes, but definitely lots of food for thought. I found it for 5 bucks.

candice

messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] GREAT BOOK
messages.msgSnippet: I am currently reading The Teenage Liberation Handbook - How to quit school and get a real life and education by Grace Llewellyn. It s fabulous!! Anyone here
messages.messageBody:
I am currently reading "The Teenage Liberation Handbook - How to quit school
and get a real life and education" by Grace Llewellyn. It's fabulous!!

Anyone here read that one?

Nicoletta

Yes, TTLH is very heady stuff, isn't it? I plan to have my always
unschooled, completely unappreciative 11 year old daughter read it at some
point. Maybe she'll better understand how free she is by comparison.

---Valerie

> Message: 11
> Date: Wed, 30 Aug 2000 17:52:33 -0700
> From: "Kim" <sinclai@...>
> Subject: Unschooling Handbook
>
> BlankHi All,
> I just had to share this. My friend who is an avid unschooler, just lent
me a book titled, 'The Unschooling Handbook' by Mary Griffith. It is a
wonderful book! I couldn't put it down! I have already read half of the
book today! I recommend it to anyone who is unschooling, thinking about
unschooling, unschools but has doubts about their kids not learning
anything, READ IT!!!! I wish that I would have found this book a long time
ago!
> Has anyone else on this list read it?
> Kim
